required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Intravenous Infusion of Paracetamol for Intrapartum Analgesia of Labor
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Intravenous Infusion of Paracetamol as Intrapartum Analgesic in the First Stage of Labor: a Double-blind Randomized Trial

brief_summary.textblock: This is a double-blind randomized trial evaluates the efficacy of intravenous infusion of Paracetamol as intrapartum analgesic in the first stage of labour.

detailed_description.textblock: Comparison of efficacy and safety of intravenous infusion of paracetamol versus placebo (intravenous sterile water infusion) in parturient women in active first phase of labour and requiring intrapartum analgesia.

primary_outcome.measure: To assess the efficacy of intravenous infusion of paracetamol in comparison with placebo (sterile water for injection) in labouring women
primary_outcome.time_frame: Start of medication till end of first stage of labour. Participants will be followed for the duration of labour, an expected average of 8 hours.
primary_outcome.description: By recoding the need for a rescue additional analgesia and measuring the degree of pain relief (Visual analogue score) during the labor process.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Start of medication till delivery and neonatal assesment. Participants will be followed during this duration of labour, an expected average of 10 hours.
secondary_outcome.description: By assessing the adverse events recorded during the study either maternal or fetal/neonatal.

secondary_outcome.measure: To correlate with the duration of labor
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Start of medication till end of second stage of labour. Participants will be followed for the duration of labour, an expected average of 9 hours.
secondary_outcome.description: The difference between both groups regarding labour duration

intervention.description: Drugs: (1) Bottle containing 1000 mg Paracetamol in 100 ml solution for intravenous infusion
Drugs: (2) Bottle containing 100 ml sterile water for intravenous infusion

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Age between 18-35 years.
2. Primigravida.
3. The gestational age between 37- 42 weeks.
4. Patient seeking analgesia.
5. Single viable fetus.
6. Vertex presentation.
7. Spontaneous onset of labor.
8. 1st stage of labor with cervical dilatation 3-4 cm ( in active phase).
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Extreme of age (below 18-above 35).
2. Multiparity.
3. Multiple gestation.
4. Malpresentation.
5. Major degree of cephalopelvic disproportion.
6. Any medical disorder with pregnancy e.g., Rheumatic heart disease, Diabetes mellitus, Hypertension, Anemia.
7. Induction of labor.
8. Cervical dilatation exceeds exceeding 4 cm.
9. Use of any other kind of analgesia before recruitment in the study.
10. Scared uterus.
11. Fetal distress.
12. Antepartum hemorrhage.
13. Intrapartum bleeding.
14. Polyhydramnios.
15. Pre-mature rupture of membranes.
16. Intra uterine infections.
17. Hypersensitivity to paracetamol.

overall_official.affiliation: OB GYN Department, faculty of Medicine, ASU
